page.title: 05Chapelthorpe Church_1800
page.content: The present church was re_built in 1773 and is only a short distance from Chapelthorpe Hall. The church is a square, plain stone building with round_headed plain windows. There is one bell which is contained in a round bell turret. In the East end of the church a beautiful coloured window has been placed above the alter. A ledgend states that it was dedicated to the memory of John Mackie by his wife Mary Elizabeth. Inside the church there is a benefaction board which shows amounts of money left by the wealthier people of Chapelthorpe to various charities when they died. The Sunday school was the most popular charity. The register books for the baptisims kept at the Church date back to 1829. The old baptismal books are kept at Sandal. There is no cemetary at Chapelthorpe .
